Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 51b557b71fa336b1f6cce54ce4c57e34b8452707
this need to be checked before it is used in line902

this section is a bit hard for me to read. Part of the reason is the prefix of the fruArearParams everywhere.  I think local variables with shorter and easier to understand variable names and the fruAreaParams struct can be updated before the function returns.

It is not obvious what these parameters are.
1. Isn't this: fieldLoc + length?
2. what is the difference between endofFieldsLoc and end?
Please add comments for what they are, it will help review the actual function

1. Isn't this: fieldLoc + length?
   No. restFRUFieldsLoc is starting offset/location of the restFRU field data.
2. what is the difference between endofFieldsLoc and end?
   endofFieldsLoc is ending offset/location of restFRU field data.
   end refers here is fruAreaEnd. end offset/location of fruArea.
  
   Done.

Function name is confusing, after reading function body several times, I think it is saving fields post the field with propertyName into resetFRUAreaFieldsData. Maybe saveResetFRUArea or getRestFRUArea or copyRestFRUArea?
Similar to https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/56838 comment, please add brief description, input output definition
I am not sure this needs to be in this structure
I don't think this needs to be in this structure.
Need to be consistent in how FRU is commented.  It is shown as FRU, fru and Fru in these comments.
clarify what part of fruArearParams are updated
I don't think this needs to be a parameter in line 1115 and line 1123

This does not need to be an input/output parameter. It can just be local
size_t loc = fruArearParams.updateFieldLoc;
not needed, these fields are read-only in this function
Looking good now. Only a couple minor questions.
I think restFruAreaField is the rest of the fields in FRU area after the field that is being updated.
does fruAreaParams.restFieldsEnd need to be updated also?

not needed. fruAreaParams.restFieldsEnd is updated in copyRestFRUArea function and used in line no : 1134, to check the boundary condition for fruAreaLoc. 

Here, fruAreaDataEnd is new variable and it is calculated with restFRU starting offset and restFRU data size. fruAreaDataEnd is used as EndOfFieldsOffset in further code.

Corrected spelling mistake :
Gentle reminder for review.
